TopicTitle: Diffuse Texture on bumped material switching

Articles.Content:
Hello. I've been working on updating models for the Civilian Population mod. I've been getting an irritating texture issue with a couple of the redone parts - a medium and small sized food-growing part. If I add the medium part into the VAB, one of its textures doesn't display properly - it's a vent material with a diffuse texture and a normal-map texture. The normal-map shows up properly, but the diffuse is replaced by a dirt texture, which is on another section of the model. This results in part of the model looking like its made of dirt that has vents coming out of it.

This is from a previous version of the model, but it shows the same issue:

![zji4n6.png](http://i61.tinypic.com/zji4n6.png)

 The small-sized part uses the same vent texture, but doesn't use the dirt texture. If I add the small-sized part into the editor on its own, it shows-up fine, but if I add in the medium part, then attach the small part to it, the vent texture on the small part also displays the dirt texture instead of the vent diffuse texture. I have been trying to fix this for the past week with no success. Any help would be appreciated. Thanks

Could you post the following information?:

- The CFG file of the affected parts

 - The texture format (PNG? TGA? MBM? DDS?)

 - The diffuse texture

 - The normal texture

 - The UV map of the model (if you didn't make the model yourself, you can use [taniwha's Blender .mu import/export addon](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/43513-Blender-mu-import-export-addon) to import the MU model file, and export the UV layout of all the meshes as an image)

I didn't design or make the original, but I have remade most of it. I hadn't thought to try reimporting the .mu files. When I try, it gives a lot of errors. Also, the option to export from blender with the Mu exporter is grayed out. All the textures in the mod are PNGs at the moment, and there are a lot of textures used. Here's a bundle of the .blends, .Mus and textures in question:

[https://mega.nz/#!QpRSlbIL!cwJmtsmOmqDp6Jx-BiPmZMI1BK7vlSyOnHhVUHjaCrU](https://mega.nz/#!QpRSlbIL!cwJmtsmOmqDp6Jx-BiPmZMI1BK7vlSyOnHhVUHjaCrU)

Well, I've circumvented the issue now by rebuilding the affected meshes from scratch. Should have tried that from the start, I guess. It was probably something to do with duplicated uv maps, or duplicated UV map names. All sorted now, anyway.

Good to hear that things have worked out!

By, the way, I should've made this clearer, but when I originally requested the aforementioned diagnostic info, I wasn't actually asking for the files themselves, just screenshots ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Oh, okay. I wasn't able to export a uv map image, either way. There's a steep learning curve with all of this stuff.

And thanks for offering to help.

Okay, I discovered that the whole problem was down to this one texture. It refused to show up in game, and the only way to get around it was to copy the colour info into a new file. If anyone can say what is wrong with the image, I'd appreciate it.
